instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image on both internal and external monitors
threads.message:
Hi,

I have another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board in for repair. According to the customer, this one started slowly dying out on him about a year ago.
Every 15 minutes or so image disappears and sometimes the machine will restart and give a GPU panic error. Sometimes there is no image on boot at all. No image on external monitor.
L9000 and <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> are 0V when no image.

Please advice how to proceed.

Thanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image on both internal and external monitors
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image on both internal and external monitors
threads.message:
Holy macaroni it worked! Checked that bastard under microscope and it looked nice and shiny with no damage. Resoldered it and it works like a charm now. Tested with full ASD test and 2 hours on donut test (Furmark).

Unbelievable....
